revised_title: Proving the Existence of a Fluid in the Nerves
tldr: The author, Alexander Stuart, conducted experiments to prove the existence of a fluid in the nerves, also known as animal spirits. He demonstrated that the brain and nerves contribute significantly to muscle movement and that this action cannot be due to elasticity. Stuart concluded that the action of nerves in muscle movement is caused by the fluid they contain, which he suggests is similar to the properties of air, even though it is invisible.
